160: Job Description JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for internal audit support to the Contact Center, including the Sales & Guest Services organizations. Act as direct point of contact between the Corporate Audit area and the Contact Center organization. Position is responsible for partnering with the business to provide areas of opportunity for additional support and call monitoring and adherence. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Responsible for all required audits for the contact center to be performed according to policies & procedures for each function. Review and ensure reporting stats are updated monthly with accuracy. Establish any new audits or reporting stats requested. Work as a partner between the internal contact center audit team and Corporate Audit and all departments impacted by these audits. Prepare and issue quarterly stats and annual presentation to senior management. Work with the IT department to ensure all required reports are being received and if not, work with them to resolve any issues. Responsible for communicating audit findings to management and generating issue reports that provide the audit findings with corresponding key items to action on. Update the policies & procedures as needed, to ensure it always includes the latest information. Prepare ad hoc reports and analysis as requested by the Manager. QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES: Bachelors Degree Finance/Accounting, or related field of study 2 years of Carnival Cruise Line Contact Center experience preferred for internal candidates or previous experience in a similar audit role for 2 years preferred. Organizational skills to meet deadlines in fast paced, changing work environment. Must be detail orientated and possess the ability to organize documentation. Ability to communicate results succinctly to management in writing and verbally. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work with minimal supervision MS Excel, MS Word, Hyperion or comparable application or tools #LI-BM1 The yearly rate for this role is $45,000- $65,000. Offers to selected candidates will be made on a fair and equitable basis, taking into account specific job-related skills and experience.
